title.native: 花咲くいろは HOME SWEET HOME
title.english: Hanasaku Iroha the Movie ~ HOME SWEET HOME ~

description:
In the days before the Bonbori Festival, Ohana's friend Yuina comes to Kissuiso for training. While cleaning up after her, Ohana discovers a logbook kept by Beans from when her mother, Satsuki, was still a youth at Kissuisso. Through the logbook, Ohana catches a glimpse of her mother's struggles, and realizes that maybe the two of them aren't so different after all. Meanwhile, the rest of the inn staff are caught up in dealing with a blackout.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description: Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

Originating from Studio Annapuru, where he worked under the supervision of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). He went independent after leaving the studio in 1991. As a freelancer he worked on numerous works as a key animator and started quickly getting recognized as one of the strongest action animators in the industry.

In 2000, Andou made his debut as an episode director with [Medarot](https://anilist.co/anime/1138/)'s 49th episode, and started gradually shifting his focus from animating to directing and storyboarding episodes himself. He mainly worked on studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' productions in the early '00s, and got to direct several episodes of [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/). In 2007, he directed [Sword of the Stranger](https://anilist.co/anime/2418/), a film which was also produced by Bones. He has since directed multiple shows for both Bones and [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Noted for his action storyboards. He is also close friends with [Masahiro Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and often works with him.

_Note: Not to be confused with older animator [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/155926/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/horiken2000)

Founder and representative director of [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mellco)

Illustrator mainly for light novels who first debuted in 2004.

[Website](http://nanoripe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanoripe_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nano.ripe/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL-qIf8MciqDx0VJsQDIsHw)

__Formed:__ 1998
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
nano.RIPE is a two-piece Japanese pop rock band under record label Lantis (2010–), affiliated with the entertainment office Highway Star. 

__Biography:__
The band was formed in 1998 with the members Kimiko and Jun who were classmates in their prefectural high school in Chiba. They debuted as an indie band in 2008, releasing one single and three albums before they eventually made their major debut in 2010, while also signing to record label Lantis in the same year.

__Members:__
- [Kimiko](https://anilist.co/staff/169452/Kimiko) (季美子, きみコ) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics (1998–)
- [Sasaki Jun](https://anilist.co/staff/169454/Jun-Sasaki) (佐々木淳, ササキジュン) – guitarist, chorus, in-charge of composition (1998–)

__Former Members:__
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist (2010–2016)
- Yuuki Aoyama (青山友樹) – drummer (2013–2016) ([deceased](https://natalie.mu/music/news/298104))
- shinn. – drummer (–2011)

__Support Members:__
- [Hiroki Takahashi](https://twitter.com/takahashi_drum) (高橋宏貴) – drummer
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist
- [Naoya "choku" Suzuki](https://twitter.com/choku_nary) (鈴木"choku"直也) – bassist
- [Takumi Sugama](https://twitter.com/sugamatakumi) (菅間匠) – drummer
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Higashiji)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/322149349)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).
A former Studio Easter employee. Debuted as an art director on [Guin Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/5041/).

Frequents on [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' projects, but is freelance.

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).
In-betweener turned CG artist. Formerly affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/michi1020)

Mitsuhito Tsuji is a producer for P.A. Works.

Originating from Studio Annapuru, where he worked under the supervision of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). He went independent after leaving the studio in 1991. As a freelancer he worked on numerous works as a key animator and started quickly getting recognized as one of the strongest action animators in the industry.

In 2000, Andou made his debut as an episode director with [Medarot](https://anilist.co/anime/1138/)'s 49th episode, and started gradually shifting his focus from animating to directing and storyboarding episodes himself. He mainly worked on studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' productions in the early '00s, and got to direct several episodes of [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/). In 2007, he directed [Sword of the Stranger](https://anilist.co/anime/2418/), a film which was also produced by Bones. He has since directed multiple shows for both Bones and [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Noted for his action storyboards. He is also close friends with [Masahiro Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and often works with him.

_Note: Not to be confused with older animator [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/155926/)._

**Spouse:** [Masumi Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/103635/Masumi-Itou) (alternatively known as Hikaru Nanase)

**Yoshiyuki Itou** is a Japanese producer, music producer and animation planner. He works as a music producer for the company Lantis.

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/anzai_takebumi)**

Takefumi Anzai is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

Originating from Studio Annapuru, where he worked under the supervision of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). He went independent after leaving the studio in 1991. As a freelancer he worked on numerous works as a key animator and started quickly getting recognized as one of the strongest action animators in the industry.

In 2000, Andou made his debut as an episode director with [Medarot](https://anilist.co/anime/1138/)'s 49th episode, and started gradually shifting his focus from animating to directing and storyboarding episodes himself. He mainly worked on studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' productions in the early '00s, and got to direct several episodes of [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/). In 2007, he directed [Sword of the Stranger](https://anilist.co/anime/2418/), a film which was also produced by Bones. He has since directed multiple shows for both Bones and [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Noted for his action storyboards. He is also close friends with [Masahiro Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and often works with him.

_Note: Not to be confused with older animator [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/155926/)._
Originally an animator. Still animates on occasions.
